text:
Hi all, we had our Trial for our test account expired but the developer portal is not allowing us to renew it. Has anyone faced similar issues? Can someone from Hs extend our trial for that account?

HS Account Id: 26463556

Hi Gabriel! One thing that I was wondering, it looks like your trials might have already expired -- that could be why you're having trouble renewing them for this portal under your developer test account.

If you could, I would reach out to HubSpot support for assistance with this one, unless you want to try again 24 hours after you got that message.

Sorry for being of limited help here -- I do work here at HubSpot, but I would encourage you to contact Support for this kind of issue (I'm not quite the right kind of person to help with this one, but they should be able to give you a hand).

Has anyone had a problem where the editor page and the sandbox are different? The sandbox is correct. The editor page briefly flashes up correct before being replaced by incorrect html (A bit like previous versions of the page)
Does anybody know if you can now use the staging area for multi-language sites? Or if not what's the best current workaround?

Hi Carter,
I fixed all the issues and my CRM Card can get the feedback survey.
But my app is a private app, I cannot connect my private app with another account.
Can you give me some advice about the integration with multiple accounts?
did you build the crm card with developer projects or just normal apps
I build it with the developer projects

Here is my CRM Card.
I just get the survey information.
Currently developer projects are restricted to one portal at a time
You could either rebuild this app using a normal app, or you can wait until HubSpot releases HubSpot projects as installable apps
You could technically have your clients install the app using the cli but it would be a little difficult to setup
As you know from setting it up yourself
you have to install the cli, then authenicate it, then download the developer project, then upload the project, etc

Thank you, Carter.
Let me investigate it.
Sounds good, let me know if you have any questions
